alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Jones; Lenoir; Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 3:47PM EDT until July 09 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Jones County in eastern North Carolina... Southwestern Lenoir County in eastern North Carolina... Onslow County in eastern North Carolina... Duplin County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 347 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near La Grange to near Rose Hill to near Rowan, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, New Bern, Kinston, North Topsail Beach, Wallace, Warsaw, Pumpkin Center, Piney Green, New River Station, Half Moon, Camp Lejeune Center, Swansboro, Phillips Crossroads, Hubert, Kornegay, Rose Hill, Richlands, Beulaville, Deep Run and Maysville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
